channel.title: docker on Austin Delamar
channel.description: Recent content in docker on Austin Delamar

item.title: Learn to Code Cloud-Native Apps for Free
item.description: I was talking to a coworker the other day and they told me about their project they were working on. It was some legacy Java code on a Websphere cluster. Important work, but he was looking to branch out.

item.title: What are Cloud-Native Applications?
item.description: The term “Cloud Native” sounds simple enough, but I’ve been reading more and more posts trying to define what it actually means. Some are confused by it, or think its just marketing jargon for Cloud Foundry. What does it mean for an application to be “cloud native” in the first place?

item.title: Some Advice on Docker as a Beginner
item.description: Docker and containers in general are great. Containers are like mini virtual machines that run only the bare essentials of an operating system. And it accomplishes this at a fraction of the resources required than a regular virutal machine. This makes Docker containers ideal for many uses, such as web servers, microservices, and more.
